summary: Boku 7/11: Yasu talk about creation of my dreams. He listened to ANN when Kura revealed about it and said probably they shdnt be...
body:
Boku 7/11: Yasu talk about creation of my dreams. He listened to ANN when Kura revealed about it and said probably they shdnt be bragging about it since they’re the creator but it got great lyrics & melody lmao

Chronology: kura ask yasu if they could create a song together for kansai jr -> yasu said yes-> kura wrote lyrics, send it to yasu -> yasu voice record the melody & send it to kura -> kura adjusted the lyrics & send it to yasu->yasu record the melody again acapella-> Different day kurayasu create the demo together at home. Yasu on guitar kura on cajon

kura is particular about the techicality (where drums, piano etc comes) but yasu told him the most important thing abt this song is he wants the emotion, story & passion in this song be felt by everyone throughout their body. Kurayasu too told the jrs about what to convey & how to convey the songs so that the emotion come across during recording. Yasu wants this ‘baby’ song to mature along with jr fans

Be passed down to the next generations of jrs. Overall, Yasu is realllly reallllly proud of the lyrics that Kura had written! X3 Thank you for such beautiful songs Yasu & Kura!!

getting into a new fandom!!!!!!!

i doubt this will work but if ur into bnha, post about bnha, cry about bnha, make art about bnha, write fics about bnha, or anything like that please!!! like or repost or comment because!! sCREEEE

im still on season two but like,, i dive into fandoms with the knowledge of consequence

sometimes I’m like ... I should just own up and post HS stuff on my main blog
and then I’m like
mmm ... I don’t want my fandom...
body:
sometimes I’m like … I should just own up and post HS stuff on my main blog

and then I’m like

mmm … I don’t want my fandom experience tainted by inviting antis into my home

which is WILD because that blog was originally 1000000% homestuck before it got obliterated

anyway I’m gunna post some daverose art soon bc something happened between them

summary: "You are better than you think. It doesn't matter if you have 'bad' thoughts as long as you don't act on them. I believe in...
question: "You are better than you think. It doesn't matter if you have 'bad' thoughts as long as you don't act on them. I believe in you." Dadzwiashinsou
answer:
Masterlist! ~ Discord! ~ Audios!

Shinsou feels like he wants to crawl out of his own skin as he crosses through the middle of the lunch room. There are people staring at him, people he didn’t even know before the sports festival, people he never cared about. While his classmates had known his quirk from day one, these students hadn’t and Shinsou can feel the weight of their stares like tons of pressure pushing down on his shoulders.

The tension doesn’t leave for weeks. The eyes still follow him around, like these people are waiting for the moment he’s no longer a comrade but an enemy in the making. It makes him feel cold and sends him to the empty training rooms well past open hours. It’s better than the dorms… much better than home.

That’s where he meets Aizawa-sensei, homeroom teacher of class 1-A. His first reaction is to go stone like and freeze when the man slips in and makes himself known, likely a good while after he’s already been there, watching Shinsou go at a bag until his knuckles felt ready to pop out of their joints. They stare at each other, Shinsou winded and panting for breath and Aizawa, leaned back against the door frame, arms folded over his chest.

“What?” Shinsou asks. He knows his tone holds no respect but it’s late and he’s so fucking done with his day. He doesn’t need anyone just standing there and judging him.

“Your stance is off.”

It’s a blatant answer to his question and Shinsou can feel the automatic space where his consciousness could push in, the moment where there’s a hollow emptiness for his quirk to slip through Aizawa’s defenses. He expects the teacher to activate his own quirk the moment he responds but he doesn’t even twitch at Shinsou whose shoulders are still tense and shaking. It’s those sickening thoughts, those moments in between his choice of taking control or not where other peoples whisper of “villain” makes him want to press in, just out of spite. He thinks Aizawa has to see that in his eyes, the anger, the burn of it all. That’s why he steps further into the room and shows him how to punch the bag right.

It goes on from there. Months into the newest semester and he’s learning how to use capture tape, a scarf of the stuff bundled on his shoulders exactly like Aizawa’s. Shinsou will admit to no one that his throat had gotten terribly tight when the teacher held it out for him to take one afternoon. When Aizawa leads him to the support room to get fitted into hero gear, he almost cries. He tells no one in his class and no one at home about the actual hero training he’s receiving. He doesn’t want to hear their reactions.

He can’t always keep it under wraps though, it’s not like his sensei cares about what students or other teachers think. He can feel those eyes on him when Aizawa pulls him aside to remind him about training and push a juice pack into his hands. He can hear their whispers even if they hide them behind their hands.  

“Why’s a hero course teacher paying attention to him?”

“Maybe he’s controlling him…”

“That guy’s still playing a hero?”

Shinsou can feel acid on his tongue and each little blank space he could fill to get them to shut up. It would be easy, slipping into those cracks and embarrassing them like they’re doing to him. Instead, he blows off his lunch meeting with Aizawa and goes to what he’s come to consider his training room. There’s where Aizawa finds him twenty minutes later.

He doesn’t say anything, he doesn’t have to, for Shinsou to know that he’s there. They’ve been training long enough now that Shinsou can pick up his specific presence more easily than anyone else. The teacher is silent as he watches Shinsou go at his bag, fists hastily bandaged but at the very least protected. Aizawa, like he always does, like no one else in his fucking life because they’re terrified of what Shinsou could do to them, waits for the boy to speak first.

“I wanted to make them shut up.” He hits the bag, each slam of his fist punctuating his sentences as he lets go of the feelings in his chest. “I wanted to slip in and make them stop. I could have done it. So easily. I wanted to.” He doesn’t say he should have, because he knows he shouldn’t and he won’t. He never would. But the way his stomach twists with nausea only tells him how much he desired it.

Shinsou, for all his knowledge that Aizawa is there, doesn’t know until he’s turning around, expecting a response of some kind, that Aizawa is right behind him, one hand in his pocket, the other already raised to catch Shinsou’s trembling shoulders. This time he doesn’t know if he’s shaking with nerves or with fatigue. Aizawa is pretty much the only person in his life that isn’t scared of him and Shinsou, for all his bluster, doesn’t want his sensei to start being that way because of those urges. Aizawa’s fingers curl over his shoulder and silently tugs him into a strange but warm hug. Shinsou had almost forgotten what those felt like. He shakes harder in the teacher’s arms.

“You are better than you think,” Aizawa starts out, his chin propped up on Shinsou’s head. “It doesn’t matter if you have ‘bad’ thoughts as long as you don’t act on them.” Shinsou starts to shudder harder against his chest and Aizawa feels the boy’s hands go to his back and clench down hard. “I believe in you,” it’s said softer as he holds the kid just a bit tighter. In the back of his mind, Aizawa doesn’t really know what’s possessed him to be this soft. Maybe it was the look in Shinsou’s eyes that first night in the training room, or the determination in his shoulders as he keeps his head high regardless of the not subtle whispers that followed him, or maybe, just maybe, he’s saying it because he’s reminded of himself, more than a decade younger, and the words he’d wished someone had said to him when he’d been in such a similar position.

They pull back and Shinsou wipes his eyes with the back of his hand, quick, like he’s just rubbing away dust instead of half-shed tears. Aizawa tucks his free hand into his pocket and steps back. There’s a moment of silence before he turns on his heel.

“Class is in five.”

“Yeah…”

Aizawa smirks.

“And your stance was off again.” There’s a choked off cry of indignation thrown at his back as he heads to his class, one in which, he hopes to see his protege’s face in very soon.

reblog.comment:
Masterlist! ~ Discord! ~ Audios!

Shinsou feels like he wants to crawl out of his own skin as he crosses through the middle of the lunch room. There are people staring at him, people he didn’t even know before the sports festival, people he never cared about. While his classmates had known his quirk from day one, these students hadn’t and Shinsou can feel the weight of their stares like tons of pressure pushing down on his shoulders.

The tension doesn’t leave for weeks. The eyes still follow him around, like these people are waiting for the moment he’s no longer a comrade but an enemy in the making. It makes him feel cold and sends him to the empty training rooms well past open hours. It’s better than the dorms… much better than home.

That’s where he meets Aizawa-sensei, homeroom teacher of class 1-A. His first reaction is to go stone like and freeze when the man slips in and makes himself known, likely a good while after he’s already been there, watching Shinsou go at a bag until his knuckles felt ready to pop out of their joints. They stare at each other, Shinsou winded and panting for breath and Aizawa, leaned back against the door frame, arms folded over his chest.

“What?” Shinsou asks. He knows his tone holds no respect but it’s late and he’s so fucking done with his day. He doesn’t need anyone just standing there and judging him.

“Your stance is off.”

It’s a blatant answer to his question and Shinsou can feel the automatic space where his consciousness could push in, the moment where there’s a hollow emptiness for his quirk to slip through Aizawa’s defenses. He expects the teacher to activate his own quirk the moment he responds but he doesn’t even twitch at Shinsou whose shoulders are still tense and shaking. It’s those sickening thoughts, those moments in between his choice of taking control or not where other peoples whisper of “villain” makes him want to press in, just out of spite. He thinks Aizawa has to see that in his eyes, the anger, the burn of it all. That’s why he steps further into the room and shows him how to punch the bag right.

It goes on from there. Months into the newest semester and he’s learning how to use capture tape, a scarf of the stuff bundled on his shoulders exactly like Aizawa’s. Shinsou will admit to no one that his throat had gotten terribly tight when the teacher held it out for him to take one afternoon. When Aizawa leads him to the support room to get fitted into hero gear, he almost cries. He tells no one in his class and no one at home about the actual hero training he’s receiving. He doesn’t want to hear their reactions.

He can’t always keep it under wraps though, it’s not like his sensei cares about what students or other teachers think. He can feel those eyes on him when Aizawa pulls him aside to remind him about training and push a juice pack into his hands. He can hear their whispers even if they hide them behind their hands.  

“Why’s a hero course teacher paying attention to him?”

“Maybe he’s controlling him…”

“That guy’s still playing a hero?”

Shinsou can feel acid on his tongue and each little blank space he could fill to get them to shut up. It would be easy, slipping into those cracks and embarrassing them like they’re doing to him. Instead, he blows off his lunch meeting with Aizawa and goes to what he’s come to consider his training room. There’s where Aizawa finds him twenty minutes later.

He doesn’t say anything, he doesn’t have to, for Shinsou to know that he’s there. They’ve been training long enough now that Shinsou can pick up his specific presence more easily than anyone else. The teacher is silent as he watches Shinsou go at his bag, fists hastily bandaged but at the very least protected. Aizawa, like he always does, like no one else in his fucking life because they’re terrified of what Shinsou could do to them, waits for the boy to speak first.

“I wanted to make them shut up.” He hits the bag, each slam of his fist punctuating his sentences as he lets go of the feelings in his chest. “I wanted to slip in and make them stop. I could have done it. So easily. I wanted to.” He doesn’t say he should have, because he knows he shouldn’t and he won’t. He never would. But the way his stomach twists with nausea only tells him how much he desired it.

Shinsou, for all his knowledge that Aizawa is there, doesn’t know until he’s turning around, expecting a response of some kind, that Aizawa is right behind him, one hand in his pocket, the other already raised to catch Shinsou’s trembling shoulders. This time he doesn’t know if he’s shaking with nerves or with fatigue. Aizawa is pretty much the only person in his life that isn’t scared of him and Shinsou, for all his bluster, doesn’t want his sensei to start being that way because of those urges. Aizawa’s fingers curl over his shoulder and silently tugs him into a strange but warm hug. Shinsou had almost forgotten what those felt like. He shakes harder in the teacher’s arms.

“You are better than you think,” Aizawa starts out, his chin propped up on Shinsou’s head. “It doesn’t matter if you have ‘bad’ thoughts as long as you don’t act on them.” Shinsou starts to shudder harder against his chest and Aizawa feels the boy’s hands go to his back and clench down hard. “I believe in you,” it’s said softer as he holds the kid just a bit tighter. In the back of his mind, Aizawa doesn’t really know what’s possessed him to be this soft. Maybe it was the look in Shinsou’s eyes that first night in the training room, or the determination in his shoulders as he keeps his head high regardless of the not subtle whispers that followed him, or maybe, just maybe, he’s saying it because he’s reminded of himself, more than a decade younger, and the words he’d wished someone had said to him when he’d been in such a similar position.

They pull back and Shinsou wipes his eyes with the back of his hand, quick, like he’s just rubbing away dust instead of half-shed tears. Aizawa tucks his free hand into his pocket and steps back. There’s a moment of silence before he turns on his heel.

“Class is in five.”

“Yeah…”

Aizawa smirks.

“And your stance was off again.” There’s a choked off cry of indignation thrown at his back as he heads to his class, one in which, he hopes to see his protege’s face in very soon.

summary:
The photo on this My Hero academia costume evokes some kind of emotion, I just don’t know what.
Please, discuss.

summary:
#işimizi #dikkatli #yapmazsak #boku #yeriz
'' Tıp fakültesinde ilk kez kadavra başına toplanan öğrenciler, baya bir merak ve...
caption:
#işimizi #dikkatli #yapmazsak #boku #yeriz
“ Tıp fakültesinde ilk kez kadavra başına toplanan öğrenciler, baya bir merak ve ilgiyle kadavrayı incelemektedirler..
Profesör dersine başlar.. ‘Tıpta iki şey doktorlar için çok önemlidir, ilki insan vücudu ile ilgili hiç bir şey sizin için iğrenç olmamalıdır..’ Örneğin, der ve parmağını cesedin kıçına sokar ve çıkartıp kendi ağzına götürür..
'Hadi bakalım şimdi sizlerde aynı şeyi yapınız..!’
Ögrenciler şok içinde, hepsi duraksarlar ama bakarlar ki profesör çok ciddi, istemeye istemeye hepsi sırayla kadavranın kıçını parmaklayıp sonrada emerler..
Öğrencilerin hepsi bu işin tadına bakıp berbat bir hale gelmişken, profesör konuşmasını sürdürür;
'Bir tıp doktoru için ikinci en önemli nokta gözlemdir’ der ve devam eder; 'Ben kadavranın kıçına orta parmağımı soktum ama kendi ağzıma işaret parmağımı götürdüm..’ Şimdi bir doktor için, dikkat etmenin ne kadar önemli olduğunu da öğrenmiş bulunuyorsunuz..!’
Neymiş..?
Sonuç olarak, işimizi dikkatli yapmazsak boku yeriz.. ”
#hızır #hizir #hızırinan #hizirinan #inan (Ankara, Turkey)
https://www.instagram.com/p/BodeHeIncDh/?utm_source=ig_tumblr_share&igshid=11hsjyu65md5l

summary:
Aquí el primer avance en #video de la cuarta temporada del #anime #BokuNoHeroAcademia
  Que tal a toda la banda de...
caption:
Aquí el primer avance en #video de la cuarta temporada del #anime #BokuNoHeroAcademia

Que tal a toda la banda de MultiAnime! El día de hoy se ha lanzado en el canal oficial de Toho Animation, el primer teaser trailer de la cuarta temporada de uno de los animes que la están rompiendo últimamente, nos referimos a My Hero Academia (Boku No Hero Academia). Recordemos que hace unos dí…

Lee la nota completa en MultiAnime.com.mx https://multianime.com.mx/2018/09/29/aqui-el-primer-avance-en-video-de-la-cuarta-temporada-del-anime-bokunoheroacademia/
